name: Hypervisible
description:
"What we are experiencing here is our incapability to accept meaninglessness. We have to face that maybe, all that is happening here is a woman turning dark for no reason at all - we have to face that she might not be a sign, a symbol or a symptom, that there is no cause for all of this, and that maybe, and that is not my theory alone, but that of many others-", she declares while pointlessly adjusting her glasses, "of many others, that we are not able to see anything in a way that is not metaphorical because language and basically any string of text are metaphorical and often already fictionalizing. And if this is the case, the woman in the cube has, to an extent, ceased to exist."

***

"-simply not correct to cage people in", the news anchor shouts at her because she turned up the volume too quickly, "no matter how much we theorize about this, we all agree that what is happening in the cube is a crime."

***

You watch someone. Everybody is watching her.

Which is particularly interesting because nobody can see her.
